intro: Halenia weddelliana, commonly known as the Weddell's halenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and coastal conditions. The leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance.
